meanings.definition: Stubbornness or a difficult and contrary disposition.
meanings.sent1: Her orneriness made it challenging to convince her to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The child's orneriness showed when he refused to share his toys.
meanings.sent3: Despite his orneriness, he always had a soft spot for stray animals.
meanings.sent4: The orneriness of the old tree roots made it hard to dig them out of the ground.
meanings.sent5: The orneriness of the cat was legendary in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The quality of being irritable or easily annoyed.
meanings.sent1: His orneriness flared up whenever someone disturbed his peace.
meanings.sent2: She tried to avoid his orneriness by keeping the noise level down.
meanings.sent3: The orneriness of the alarm clock was particularly annoying on Monday mornings.
meanings.sent4: The orneriness of the old door hinges made them squeak loudly with every movement.
meanings.sent5: The orneriness of the customer was evident in the way he complained about everything.
